intro: Epacris impressa var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered epacris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing pink to red flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant collections. This variety is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in coastal and dry environments.
